abstract: The announcement was the first open acknowledgment that the Kremlin would use its controlling votes on the boards of directors of major companies to force economic policy decisions.
snippet: The announcement was the first open acknowledgment that the Kremlin would use its controlling votes on the boards of directors of major companies to force economic policy decisions.
lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — The Russian government said Tuesday that it was forcing five major state-controlled exporters, including the publicly traded energy behemoths Gazprom and Rosneft, to limit their foreign currency holdings to help prop up the ruble.

headline.main: As Ruble Falters, Russia Forces Exporters to Reduce Foreign Currency
headline.print_headline: As Ruble Falters, Russia Forces Exporters to Reduce Foreign Currency
